page.title: 19RIPPINGALE GROUP OF CHURCHES
page.content: The Rev.R.Harris is the incumbent of the{Rippingale Group of Parishes}which consists of Rippingale,Dunsby and Dowsby.It is not uncommon in rural areas to group parishes together under the care of one priest,for reasons of economy and a shortage of clergy.The parishes of Dunsby and Dowsby became united in 1934 and the responsibility of the Rector of Rippingale in 1967. {Rippingale and Dowsby}are dedicated to St.Andrew,the Patron Saint of Seafarers,a reminder of the days before the fens were drained and the sea was close.{Dunsby}is dedicated to All Saints.All three churches date from about 1250.Although attendance is only about 12% of the population the Church is still a unifying force in the social and spiritual life of the community.
